definitions.definition: distribute (cards) in an orderly rotation to the players for a game or round.
examples: the cards were dealt for the last hand
synonyms: allocate; informaldivvy up "the cards were dealt"

definitions.definition: include a new player in a card game by giving them cards.
distribute or mete out (something) to a person or group.
examples: the funds raised were dealt out to the needy

definitions.definition: take part in commercial trading of a particular commodity.
examples: directors were prohibited from dealing in the company's shares
synonyms: smuggle; informalpush "the company deals in high-tech goods"

definitions.definition: be concerned with.
examples: a movie that deals in ideas and issues
synonyms: analyze "the article deals with advances in chemistry"

definitions.definition: buy and sell illegal drugs.
take measures concerning (someone or something), especially with the intention of putting something right.
examples: the government had been unable to deal with the economic crisis
synonyms: behave toward "how to deal with difficult children"

definitions.definition: cope with (a difficult person or situation).
examples: you'll have to find a way of dealing with those feelings

definitions.definition: treat (someone) in a particular way.
examples: life had dealt harshly with her

definitions.definition: have relations with (a person or organization), especially in a commercial context.
examples: the bank deals directly with the private sector

definitions.definition: take or have as a subject; discuss.
examples: the novel deals with several different topics

definitions.definition: inflict (a blow) on (someone or something).
examples: hopes of an economic recovery were dealt another blow
synonyms: impose; aim "the court dealt a blow to government reforms"

definitions.definition: an agreement entered into by two or more parties for their mutual benefit, especially in a business or political context.
examples: the band signed a major recording deal

definitions.definition: an attractive price on a commodity for a purchaser; a bargain.
examples: we've got great deals on the latest camcorders

definitions.definition: a particular form of treatment given or received.
examples: working mothers get a raw deal

definitions.definition: a significant but unspecified amount of something.
examples: he lost a great deal of blood

definitions.definition: the process of distributing the cards to players in a card game.
a player's turn to distribute cards.
the round of play following this.
the set of hands dealt to the players.
